intro: Draba verna var. debeauxii, commonly known as the early spring rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in alpine and subalpine environments. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. It is characterized by its hardy nature and ability to survive in cold, rocky habitats. This variety is often found in mountainous regions across Europe and parts of Asia.
